description: Arrange the BI dashboard creation workflow in the correct order.
instructions: Think about what a dashboard needs to function: What provides compute to run queries? What defines the data before you can visualize it? What makes queries reusable? Pattern: compute → data → flexibility → visualization → alerting → automation.

blocks.code: Create a Pro SQL Warehouse with size Small and auto-stop after 10 minutes
blocks.label: Configure SQL Warehouse

blocks.code: Write SQL queries for KPIs: daily_revenue, inventory_levels, regional_sales
blocks.label: Write SQL Queries

blocks.code: Add date_range and region parameters to make queries interactive
blocks.label: Add Query Parameters

blocks.code: Create Lakeview dashboard with charts, tables, and counter visualizations
blocks.label: Build Dashboard

blocks.code: Create SQL alert: trigger when inventory_level < 50 for any SKU
blocks.label: Set Up Alerts

blocks.code: Schedule dashboard refresh every 15 minutes during business hours
blocks.label: Schedule Refresh

hints: SQL Warehouse provides the compute — must exist first
Queries define the data before visualization
Parameters make queries reusable across regions/dates
Alerts monitor query results for threshold breaches
Scheduled refresh keeps dashboards up to date automatically
learnings: SQL warehouses provide compute for queries
Alerts notify when metrics cross thresholds
